title: feature request due to inconsistent behavior of passwort setting while using ldap
body:
feature request: inconsistent behavior of passwort setting while using ldap

### expected behaviour
if a user authentication goes over ldap, then other ways of setting user and password should be linked to ldap also or
not be possible / deactivated.
it would be usefull to switch this section invisible (by css) while ldap is used. 


### actual behaviour
if a user is added via ldap, then inside the admin backend it's still offered to change the password 
via the "normal" user administration: personal --> password. but this way of administration isn't working any longer 
because of ldap connection. 


### steps to reproduce
1. connect your system to an ldap / ad server
2. got to the admin settings: personal-->password
3. try to change the password here
